pull.title: macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API
pull.body:
See https://docs.python.org/3/library/plistlib.html.
The old API was deprecated in 3.4 and removed in 3.9.

~~AFAIK the macdeployplus scripts is only used when calling `make deploy` locally (on macOS). The linux cross compile build (like gitian) are not affected by this PR.~~

events.message:
macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API

See https://docs.python.org/3/library/plistlib.html.
The new API was added in 3.4 and old removed in 3.9.

rename.from: macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API if python>=3.9
rename.to: macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API

events.body:
> AFAIK the macdeployplus scripts is only used when calling make deploy locally (on macOS). The linux cross compile build (like gitian) are not affected by this PR.

The `macdeployqtplus` script is used on macOS and Linux for the cross-compile/gitian. See here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88776c2926061482ab551b0cf5c408fc1bc39ac3/Makefile.am#L153-L155

ACK 04a69c200e0d18ae63c7e47898f85d1b4cb5c23d - I checked that `make deploy` on macOS currently fails when building master and using Python 3.9. This PR fixes that, and it's fine to use (and backport) these changes as they only require Python 3.4. Related note: I think we could just about drop our native_biplist dependency entirely given some changes upstream.

issue.title: [0.20] Backports
issue.body:
Backports the following PRs to the 0.20 branch:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19777 - docs: Correct description for getblockstats's txs field
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19836 - rpc: Properly deserialize txs with witness before signing
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20080 - Strip any trailing `/` in -datadir and -blocksdir paths
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20082 - [bugfix] random: fixes read buffer to use min rather than max
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20141 - Avoid the use of abs64 in timedata
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20146 - net: Send post-verack handshake messages at most once
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20195 - build: fix mutex detection when building bdb on macOS
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20298 - macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API

Will add additional commits as they become available.

events.body: Added to #20166 for backporting to the 0.20 branch.
Followed up with removing native_biplist in #20333.

issue.title: Make Deploy fails on Catalina
issue.body:
Make Deploy fails when compiling on MacOS Catalina (v10.15.7).
Error:
```
Error: Could not parse fancy disk image plist at "./contrib/macdeploy/fancy.plist"
make: *** [Litecoin-Core.dmg] Error 1
```

I installed the following dependencies:
```
brew install automake berkeley-db4 libtool boost miniupnpc openssl pkg-config protobuf python qt libevent qrencode librsvg
```

issue.title: [Depends] Update macOS cross-compiling toolchain
issue.body:
This backports the following upstream PRs to update the macOS cross-compiling tools:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17550
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16392
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18589
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19240
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19407
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17919
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19530
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17057
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20333
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18051
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19124
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20298
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20447

The tools being updated are

### Clang
Upgraded from `3.7.1` to `8.0.0`

### cctools

* cctools `877.8` -> `949.0.1`
* LD64 `253.9` -> `530`
* TAPI `1000.10.8`

### DSStore
Upgraded from `1.1.2` to `1.3.0` (this removes the biplist dependency)

This also effectively bumps our minimum supported macOS version to 10.12 (Sierra).

issue.title: mac deploy fix
issue.body:
**make deploy** doesn't work on MacOs anymore because of deprecation of https://docs.python.org/3/library/plistlib.html (old API was deprecated in 3.4 and removed in 3.9.).
See [bitcoin#20238](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20298) and [litecoin#678](https://github.com/litecoin-project/litecoin/issues/678).
Also cleaned up dead spaces.

issue.title: [Upstream] [Depends] Update macOS cross-compiling toolchain
issue.body:
> This backports the following upstream PRs to update the macOS cross-compiling tools:
> 
> [bitcoin#17550](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17550)
[bitcoin#16392](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16392)
[bitcoin#18589](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18589)
[bitcoin#19240](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19240)
[bitcoin#19407](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19407)
[bitcoin#17919](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17919)
[bitcoin#19530](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19530)
[bitcoin#17057](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17057)
[bitcoin#20333](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20333)
[bitcoin#18051](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18051)
[bitcoin#19124](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19124)
[bitcoin#20298](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20298)
[bitcoin#20447](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20447)
> 
> The tools being updated are
> 
> ### Clang
> Upgraded from `3.7.1` to `8.0.0`
> 
> ### cctools
> * cctools `877.8` -> `949.0.1`
> * LD64 `253.9` -> `530`
> * TAPI `1000.10.8`
> 
> ### DSStore
> Upgraded from `1.1.2` to `1.3.0` (this removes the biplist dependency)
> 
> This also effectively bumps our minimum supported macOS version to 10.12 (Sierra).

from https://github.com/PIVX-Project/PIVX/pull/2272/commits

Part of a series of updates to the macOC toolchain/deployment

issue.title: Fix compiling oBTC wallet on Mac.
issue.body:
macOS deploy: use the new plistlib API

<!--

Pull requests without a rationale and clear improvement may be closed
immediately.
-->

<!--
Please provide clear motivation for your patch and explain how it improves
Bitcoin Core user experience or Bitcoin Core developer experience
significantly:

* Any test improvements or new tests that improve coverage are always welcome.
* All other changes should have accompanying unit tests (see `src/test/`) or
  functional tests (see `test/`). Contributors should note which tests cover
  modified code. If no tests exist for a region of modified code, new tests
  should accompany the change.
* Bug fixes are most welcome when they come with steps to reproduce or an
  explanation of the potential issue as well as reasoning for the way the bug
  was fixed.
* Features are welcome, but might be rejected due to design or scope issues.
  If a feature is based on a lot of dependencies, contributors should first
  consider building the system outside of Bitcoin Core, if possible.
* Refactoring changes are only accepted if they are required for a feature or
  bug fix or otherwise improve developer experience significantly. For example,
  most "code style" refactoring changes require a thorough explanation why they
  are useful, what downsides they have and why they *significantly* improve
  developer experience or avoid serious programming bugs. Note that code style
  is often a subjective matter. Unless they are explicitly mentioned to be
  preferred in the [developer notes](/doc/developer-notes.md), stylistic code
  changes are usually rejected.
-->

<!--
Bitcoin Core has a thorough review process and even the most trivial change
needs to pass a lot of eyes and requires non-zero or even substantial time
effort to review. There is a huge lack of active reviewers on the project, so
patches often sit for a long time.
-->

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -586,7 +586,12 @@ if len(config.fancy) == 1:
         sys.exit(1)
     
     try:
-        fancy = plistlib.readPlist(p)
+        # the old plistlib API was removed in python3.9, use the new API instead
+        if (sys.version_info.major, sys.version_info.minor) >= (3, 9):
comments.body:
no need for this check. This has been added in python 3.4 https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/plistlib.html#plistlib.load

And we don't even support 3.4 anymore.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -586,7 +586,12 @@ if len(config.fancy) == 1:
         sys.exit(1)
     
     try:
-        fancy = plistlib.readPlist(p)
+        # the old plistlib API was removed in python3.9, use the new API instead
+        if (sys.version_info.major, sys.version_info.minor) >= (3, 9):
comments.body:
You'r right. 3.5 is our minimum anyways.
Removed the check.
